update.description:
A generic flash light plugin: **FlashLightPlugin**. It accesses <light> elements under <link> and makes them to flash and dim based on the given parameters \(duration and interval\). It has TurnOn/Off functions so a plugin inherited from this class can activate flash lights without touching ~/light/modify topic, like turning on/off a bike headlight.

A demo world file: **flash\_light\_plugin\_demo.world**. A model has two links \(cylinder and box\) and each link has two lights attached on it. Based on the parameters, the lights on the cylinder keep blinking while the ones on the box are either turned off or staying constant.

Testing code:** INTEGRATION\_flash\_light\_plugin**. It is to verify that the plugin publishes correct messages to control the lights. It listens to ~/light/modify topic and measures the actual duration/interval time and the last update time of each light. It passes if the error is within 0.01 sec.
update.title: Flash light plugin

content.raw: changes and build results look good, approving
content.html: changes and build results look good, approving

content.raw:
[https://bitbucket.org/tidota/gazebo/commits/e68b48b0eed33ba6ccd6d2e28ec0322269397055?at=flash\_light#Lplugins/FlashLightPlugin.ccT330](https://bitbucket.org/tidota/gazebo/commits/e68b48b0eed33ba6ccd6d2e28ec0322269397055?at=flash_light#Lplugins/FlashLightPlugin.ccT330)

I added a function which recursively search a link with the light element to control in nested models.  
For example, when a link is specified as `link/light`, it will find no matter which inner model has the link.

‌
content.html:
https://bitbucket.org/tidota/gazebo/commits/e68b48b0eed33ba6ccd6d2e28ec0322269397055?at=flash_light#Lplugins/FlashLightPlugin.ccT330

I added a function which recursively search a link with the light element to control in nested models.
For example, when a link is specified as link/light, it will find no matter which inner model has the link.

‌

content.raw:
also try make it work for nested models? e.g. 

    <model name="model">
      <model name="nested_model">
        <link name="link">
          <light name="light">
          </light>
        </link>
      </model>
    </model>

in this case the user will to specify `nested_model/link/light` right?
content.html:
also try make it work for nested models? e.g. 

<model name="model">
  <model name="nested_model">
    <link name="link">
      <light name="light">
      </light>
    </link>
  </model>
</model>

in this case the user will to specify nested_model/link/light right?

content.raw:
I find myself the new `for-range-loop` easier to follow in these `for` loops. Consider to use:

`for (auto &setting : this->dataPtr->listFlashLight) { setting->SwitchOff();`

Consider this suggestion in similar `for` loops.

content.raw: You don't need to declare `found`. You can just return `true`. Then, you don't need the `else` either. At the end you can return `false` directly. The same suggestion applies to other functions.

content.raw: Idea: Declare `msg` as a member variable, set the name in the constructor and you'll avoid to allocate it, deallocate it and set its name in `Flash()` and `Dim()`.
content.html: Idea: Declare msg as a member variable, set the name in the constructor and you'll avoid to allocate it, deallocate it and set its name in Flash() and Dim().
